issues.title: Interactions with Signatures problem types
issues.author: ioggstream
issues.body:
## Question

- should this I-D mention signature problem types?

comments.author: Acconut
comments.body:
During the httpapi meeting at the IETF 121 there was interest in adding a limited number of problem types for signatures. Handling HTTP message signatures can fail due to various reason and we do not want to define a problem type for every scenario to avoid blowing up the draft. In addition, a server might not want to expose certain errors to the client.

We should explore if we can easily define a small set of problem types that work for signatures and digests.

comments.author: Acconut
comments.body:
This was discussed again at the IETF 122 meeting with the outcome to not include problem types for signatures in this document. It keeps the draft focused and concise, avoiding a situation where this document is dragged on for a long time. In addition, I'm not expert at HTTP signatures and could contribute little to designing corresponding problem types.

That being said, there was some interest in problem types for signatures. But maybe that's better reserved for a separate document.

issues.title: Should responses include calculated digest?
issues.author: Acconut
issues.body:
The current draft recommends server to include the expected digest value in an error response when the digest provided by the client doesn't match the server's expectation. This opens the door to potential information leakage and oracle attacks, which potentially allows an attacker to learn about the data over which the digest was computed.

Should we remove this recommendation to include the digest calculated by the server?

Is there a good way to get an expert's opinion in this topic? Maybe through a secdir early review?

comments.author: richsalz
comments.body: Yes, we can asks for a secdir review.  But I've been involved with the SEC area stuff and yes, saying "nope this is the value" is not a good idea.

comments.author: Acconut
comments.body: Thanks for the early feedback. It makes sense to be more cautious here, so I have opened https://github.com/ietf-wg-httpapi/digest-fields-problem-types/pull/4 to remove the calculated digest from the problem type.

pulls.title: Do not include calculated digest in problem
pulls.author: Acconut

pulls.title: Allow reporting problems on multiple digests
pulls.author: Acconut
pulls.body: A request can include multiple integrity fields and each field can include multiple digests. Thus problems of the same type can appear multiple times. These changes adapt the problem types so they can carry information about multiple instances of the same problem.

reviews.author: richsalz
reviews.body: This makes sense and the text is clear.
